title: Victims named in 3 weekend shootings in Anchorage
content:
The first of the shootings occurred around 6 p.m. Saturday, when the Anchorage Police Department said 18-year-old Roderick Salas was found at a home on the 2500 block of Kona Lane in Spenard, suffering from a gunshot wound to his pelvis. Police said Salas was taken to a hospital and remained in critical condition as of Sunday.
Just hours later, at about 2 a.m. Sunday, 19-year-old Byzantium Hill died after being shot at a home on Lane Street in East Anchorage. Police were releasing few details about the death, citing an ongoing investigation.
About a half-hour later, 18-year-old Austin Leonard was taken to an Anchorage hospital after being shot while sitting inside a vehicle parked outside a mobile home on the 3300 block of Boniface Parkway. Leonard was in critical condition Sunday.
No one was injured in a fourth shooting in the area of Chena Avenue and Davis Street Sunday morning, but officers found shell casings in the area, according to APD.
Anyone with information about the shootings is asked to call 907-786-8900, or submit a tip anonymously to Crime Stoppers at 907-561-STOP or www.anchoragecrimestoppers.com.
